text: Psalm 55
Betrayal of a Friend and Trust in God
For the \add music\add* director, with stringed instruments.
A maskil of David.\f + \fr Ps 55 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Give ear, O God, \add to\add* my prayer,
and do not hide yourself from my plea.
Attend to me and answer me.
I am restless in my lamenting and I groan,
because of \add the\add* voice \add of\add* an enemy,
because of the oppression of the wicked,
because they bring down evil on me,
and in anger they hold a grudge \add against\add* me.
My heart trembles within me,
and deathly terrors fall on me.
Fear and trembling come on me,
and horror overwhelms me.
So I say, “⸤Oh, that⸥\f + \fr 55:6 \ft Literally “Who will give that” \f* I had wings like a dove.
I would fly away and be at rest.
Look, I would flee far away.
I would dwell in the wilderness. \qs Selah\qs*
I would hurry to my refuge
from \add the\add* raging wind \add and\add* storm.”
Confuse, O Lord; divide their speech,
because I see violence and strife in the city.
Day and night they go around it on its walls,
and iniquity and trouble \add are\add* in its midst.
Destruction \add is\add* within it,
and oppression and deceit
do not depart from its public square.
For \add it is\add* not an enemy \add that\add* taunts me,
or I could bear \add it\add*.
\add It is not\add* one who hates me \add that\add* magnifies himself over me,
or I could hide myself from him.
But \add it is\add* you, a man my equal,
my friend and confidant.
\add We\add* who would take sweet counsel together;
in the house\f + \fr 55:14 \ft Or “temple” \f* of God
we would walk with \add the\add* throng.
Let death deceive them. May they descend to Sheol alive,
because evil \add is\add* in their home \add and\add* ⸤heart⸥.\f + \fr 55:15 \ft Literally “inward part” \f*
As for me, I will call to God,
and Yahweh will save me.
⸤Morning, noon and night⸥\f + \fr 55:17 \ft Literally “evening and morning and noon” \f* I will lament and groan loudly,
and he will hear my voice.
He safely redeems my life from \add the\add* battle against me,\f + \fr 55:18 \ft Or “my battle” \f*
because \add those standing\add* against me are among many.
God will hear and answer them,\f + \fr 55:19 \ft Or “and humble them” \f*
\add he\add* who \add is\add* enthroned from of old, \qs Selah\qs*
Because they do not change,
and they do not fear God.
He has put forth his hands against ⸤his friends⸥;\f + \fr 55:20 \ft Literally “those at peace with him” \f*
he has defiled his covenant.
The ⸤buttery words⸥\f + \fr 55:21 \ft Literally “butter” \f* of his mouth were smooth,
but \add there was\add* battle in his heart.
His words were smoother than oil,
but they \add were\add* drawn swords.
Cast your burden on Yahweh,
and he will sustain you.
He will never allow the righteous to be moved.\f + \fr 55:22 \ft Or “shaken” \f*
But you, O God, you will bring them down to \add the\add* pit of corruption.
\add The\add* men of bloodshed and deceit will not live half their days,
but I will trust you.
